Animals.description: A sleek, medium-sized dolphin found in temperate and tropical oceans. Striped Dolphins feed on fish and squid, often hunting in coordinated pods, and are known for their energetic swimming and agility.

Animals.name: Atlantic Spotted Dolphin
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite Strike, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Tackle
Animals.description: A medium-sized dolphin found in warm Atlantic waters. Atlantic Spotted Dolphins are recognized by their distinctive spots, agile swimming, and social pod behavior, preying mainly on fish and squid.

Animals.name: Fraser’s Dolphin
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite Strike, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Tackle
Animals.description: A small-to-medium dolphin found in deep tropical and subtropical oceans. Fraser’s Dolphins feed primarily on fish and squid and are highly social, often traveling in large, tight-knit pods.

Animals.name: Rough-toothed Dolphin
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite Strike, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Tackle
Animals.description: A medium-sized dolphin found in warm and temperate oceans. Recognizable by its conical head and slightly rough teeth, it preys on squid and fish while traveling in pods.

Animals.name: Harbor Porpoise
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite Strike, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Tackle
Animals.description: A small porpoise found in coastal waters of the Northern Hemisphere. Harbor Porpoises feed on fish and squid and are known for their shy behavior and quick, agile swimming.

Animals.name: Dall’s Porpoise
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite Strike, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Tackle
Animals.description: A fast, robust porpoise found in the North Pacific. Dall’s Porpoises are known for their speed and energetic behavior, hunting fish and squid in open waters, often in small pods.

Animals.name: Narwhal
Animals.moves: Tusk Jab, Tail Slam, Sonic Blast, Agile Swim, Breach, Ice Push
Animals.description: A medium-sized Arctic whale known for its long spiral tusk. Narwhals feed on fish and squid in icy waters and are adapted to deep dives and cold environments.

Animals.name: Albacore Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast, migratory tuna species found in tropical and temperate oceans worldwide. Known for their long pectoral fins and endurance, Albacore Tuna feed on fish, squid, and crustaceans while traveling great distances.

Animals.name: Bigeye Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, deep-dwelling tuna found in tropical and temperate oceans. Bigeye Tuna feed on fish, squid, and crustaceans and are strong, fast swimmers capable of diving to great depths.

Animals.name: Pacific Bluefin Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, powerful tuna found in the Pacific Ocean. Pacific Bluefin Tuna are apex pelagic predators, feeding on smaller fish and squid, and are known for their incredible speed and long migrations.

Animals.name: Skipjack Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A small, fast tuna found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide. Skipjack Tuna feed on fish, squid, and crustaceans, often traveling in large schools for protection and hunting efficiency.

Animals.name: Southern Bluefin Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large tuna species found in the Southern Hemisphere’s temperate oceans. Southern Bluefin Tuna are fast predators, feeding on small fish and squid, and are known for their endurance and long migratory patterns.

Animals.name: Yellowfin Tuna
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, agile tuna found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide. Yellowfin Tuna feed on fish, squid, and crustaceans and are highly migratory, capable of fast, long-distance swimming.

Animals.name: Atlantic Sailfish
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast and agile predator of the Atlantic Ocean, recognized by its large dorsal sail and long bill. Atlantic Sailfish feed on small fish and squid, using bursts of speed and coordinated strikes to capture prey.

Animals.name: Indo-Pacific Sailfish
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast and highly maneuverable predator found in tropical and subtropical Indo-Pacific oceans. Indo-Pacific Sailfish feed on small fish and squid, using bursts of speed and their sail to corral prey.

Animals.name: Swordfish
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, predatory fish found in tropical and temperate oceans worldwide. Swordfish feed on fish and squid, using their powerful bills and speed to strike and incapacitate prey.

Animals.name: Black Marlin
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large and powerful predator of the Indo-Pacific, known for its speed and spear-like bill. Black Marlin feed on fish and squid, capable of explosive bursts to catch agile prey.

Animals.name: Blue Marlin
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A massive, fast-swimming predator of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Blue Marlins feed on fish and squid, using their powerful bills and speed to strike and incapacitate prey.

Animals.name: Striped Marlin
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast and agile predator of the Indo-Pacific and Eastern Pacific Oceans. Striped Marlins feed on fish and squid, using bursts of speed and their elongated bills to catch prey efficiently.

Animals.name: White Marlin
Animals.moves: Bill Jab, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast and slender predator of the Atlantic Ocean. White Marlins feed on fish and squid, using speed and agility along with their long bills to strike prey.

Animals.name: Dorado
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: Also known as Mahi-Mahi, Dorado are fast, colorful predators of tropical and subtropical oceans. They feed on small fish and squid, using speed and agility to ambush prey.

Animals.name: King Mackerel
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast and aggressive predator of the Western Atlantic and Gulf of Mexico. King Mackerel feed on smaller fish and squid, using speed and agility to ambush prey.

Animals.name: Opah
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, colorful deep-water predator found in oceans worldwide. Opah feed on squid and fish, using their unique warm-blooded metabolism to stay active in deep, cold waters.

Animals.name: Pompano Dolphinfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A smaller relative of the common Dorado, found in tropical and subtropical oceans. Pompano Dolphinfish feed on small fish and squid, using speed and agility to ambush prey.

Animals.name: Wahoo
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Agile Swim, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A fast, slender predator of tropical and subtropical oceans. Wahoos feed on fish and squid, relying on their exceptional speed and agility to capture prey.

Animals.name: Atlantic Flyingfish
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Fin Glide, Quick Leap, Water Skim, Splash Strike, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: Small, streamlined fish capable of gliding above the water surface to escape predators. They inhabit tropical and subtropical open oceans and are often seen traveling in schools.

Animals.name: Atlantic Mackerel
Animals.moves: Fang Bite, Quick Dash, Ambush, Tail Flick, River Surge, Lunge
Animals.description: A fast, schooling predator of temperate Atlantic waters, feeding on small fish and plankton. Known for its streamlined body and bursts of high-speed swimming to evade predators.

Animals.name: Atlantic Tarpon
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Powerful Jump, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Splash Strike
Animals.description: Large, silver-colored predator found in coastal and estuarine waters of the Atlantic. Tarpons are ambush hunters, feeding on smaller fish, and are famous for their spectacular leaps when hooked or threatened.

Animals.name: Escolar
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Powerful Jump, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Splash Strike
Animals.description: Also known as “Butterfish,” Escolar is a deep-sea predator found in tropical and temperate oceans. It feeds on smaller fish and squid and can rapidly move vertically to ambush prey or escape threats.

Animals.name: Fourwing Flyingfish
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Fin Glide, Quick Leap, Water Skim, Splash Strike, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A small, agile fish with unusually large pectoral fins that allow it to glide long distances above the ocean surface. It inhabits tropical and subtropical open oceans, often seen traveling in schools.

Animals.name: Platinum Halfbeak
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Fin Flick, Skim Strike, Tackle, Splash Strike, Agile Swim
Animals.description: A strikingly silvery halfbeak found in tropical coastal waters. Known for its sleek body and agility, it uses its speed and reflective scales to evade predators while feeding on plankton and small invertebrates.

Animals.name: Lancetfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Roar, Diving Strike, Tackle, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A large, predatory deep-sea fish found in tropical and temperate oceans. Lancetfish are voracious hunters, feeding on smaller fish and squid, and are known for their long, slender bodies and sharp teeth.

Animals.name: Needlefish
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Skim Strike, Tackle, Splash Strike
Animals.description: Slender, elongated fish found in tropical and temperate coastal waters. Needlefish feed on smaller fish near the surface and are known for their speed and leaping ability to avoid predators.

Animals.name: Oilfish
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Skim Strike, Tackle, Splash Strike
Animals.description: A deep-water predator found in tropical and subtropical oceans. Oilfish feed on smaller fish and squid and are known for their high oil content and ability to move efficiently through midwater and deep zones.

Animals.name: Tropical two-wing flyingfish
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Skim Strike, Tackle, Splash Strike
Animals.description: A small, agile flyingfish found in tropical open oceans. It uses its unusually large pectoral fins to glide above the water surface to escape predators, often traveling in schools.

Animals.name: Giant Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Ink Cloud, Aqua Roar, Crushing Grip, Tackle, Deep Dive
Animals.description: One of the largest invertebrate predators in the ocean, giant squids inhabit deep, cold waters of the Atlantic, Pacific, and other oceans. They feed on large fish and other squid, using their massive tentacles and beak to capture prey.

Animals.name: Humboldt Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Ink Cloud, Aqua Roar, Crushing Grip, Tackle, Deep Dive
Animals.description: Also known as the “Red Devil,” the Humboldt squid is a large, predatory cephalopod found in the eastern Pacific Ocean. It is known for its aggressive hunting tactics, rapid movements, and ability to change skin color. Humboldt squids are social creatures that often hunt in groups, using coordinated attacks to overwhelm prey.

Animals.name: Colossal Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Beak Crush, Ink Cloud, Crushing Grip, Deep Dive, Aqua Roar
Animals.description: A massive deep-sea predator of the Antarctic and Southern Oceans. Colossal squid feed on large fish and other squid, using their immense size, heavy tentacles, and sharp beak to overpower prey in the cold, deep waters.

Animals.name: Dana Octopus Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Beak Crush, Ink Cloud, Crushing Grip, Deep Dive, Aqua Roar
Animals.description: A large deep-sea squid found in temperate and tropical oceans. Dana Octopus Squid use their bioluminescent light organs to hunt and communicate in the dark depths, preying on fish and smaller squids.

Animals.name: Neon Flying Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Beak Crush, Ink Cloud, Crushing Grip, Deep Dive, Aqua Roar
Animals.description: A fast, migratory squid found in temperate and tropical oceans. Neon Flying Squid are known for their incredible speed, both in water and during short gliding leaps above the surface, making them agile hunters of fish and smaller cephalopods.

Animals.name: Vampire Squid
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Ink Cloud, Bioluminescent Flash, Aqua Roar, Grasp Strike, Deep Dive
Animals.description: A small, deep-sea cephalopod inhabiting oxygen-minimum zones of tropical and temperate oceans. Despite its name, the vampire squid primarily feeds on detritus but can defend itself aggressively using its cloak-like webbing and bioluminescence to evade predators.

Animals.name: Common Swift
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A small, fast-flying bird found across Europe, Asia, and Africa during migration seasons. Common Swifts spend most of their lives in the air, catching insects mid-flight with incredible agility.

Animals.name: Eurasian Hobby
Animals.moves: Talon Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Wing Buffet, Swift Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A small, agile falcon found across Europe, Asia, and Africa. Eurasian Hobbies are aerial hunters, preying on insects and small birds, using rapid dives and impressive maneuverability to strike with precision.

Animals.name: Great Frigatebird
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A large seabird found across tropical and subtropical oceans. Great Frigatebirds are masters of aerial foraging, often harassing other birds to steal their prey, and are known for their long wings and exceptional gliding ability.

Animals.name: Grey-headed Albatross
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A large seabird of the Southern Ocean, Grey-headed Albatrosses are long-distance gliders that spend much of their life soaring over the open ocean, feeding on squid and fish by snatching them from the water surface.

Animals.name: Mexican Free-tailed Bat
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Quick Dive, Sonic Scream, Wing Slash, Tail Strike, Agile Dash
Animals.description: A small, agile bat found across the Americas. Mexican Free-tailed Bats are fast nocturnal flyers, feeding on insects in mid-air and capable of incredible maneuverability during hunting and evasion.

Animals.name: Rock Dove
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: Commonly known as the city pigeon, Rock Doves are found worldwide in urban and rural areas. They are not strong hunters but are highly agile in flight and adapt well to varied environments.

Animals.name: Spur-winged Goose
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A large waterfowl found in sub-Saharan Africa. Spur-winged Geese are territorial birds with powerful wings and spurs, feeding on plants and small aquatic creatures, and can be surprisingly aggressive when defending territory.

Animals.name: Blue Wildebeest
Animals.moves: Horn Charge, Hoof Stomp, Tackle, Tail Whip, Agile Dash, Defensive Stance
Animals.description: A large, muscular herbivore of the African savannah. Blue Wildebeests are known for their migratory herds, powerful charges, and ability to defend themselves against predators using horns and agility.

Animals.name: Pronghorn Antelope
Animals.moves: Horn Jab, Hoof Stomp, Agile Dash, Tail Whip, Tackle, Quick Leap
Animals.description: Native to North American grasslands and deserts, pronghorns are renowned for their incredible speed and stamina, allowing them to outrun most predators. They use agility and horns for defense and rely heavily on their endurance to survive.

Animals.name: Springbok
Animals.moves: Hoof Stomp, Agile Dash, Horn Jab, Tail Whip, Quick Leap, Tackle
Animals.description: A medium-sized antelope native to southern Africa. Springboks are fast, agile herbivores that use high leaps and quick maneuvers to avoid predators, often traveling in herds for safety.

Animals.name: Mauritian Flying Fox
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Bite, Tail Strike, Aerial Dash, Gust Strike
Animals.description: Large fruit-eating bats found across tropical Asia, Australia, and some Pacific islands. Flying Foxes are strong fliers, using agility and nocturnal activity to forage on fruits and nectar while avoiding predators.

Animals.name: Big Blue Octopus
Animals.moves: Tentacle Slam, Ink Cloud, Grasp Strike, Aqua Roar, Quick Dash, Crushing Grip
Animals.description: Also known as the Day Octopus, Big Blue Octopus is a medium-to-large octopus found in tropical Indo-Pacific reefs. It is highly intelligent and uses speed, camouflage, and dexterous tentacles to hunt fish, crustaceans, and avoid predators.

Animals.name: Halloween Crab
Animals.moves: Claw Snap, Pinch, Shell Bash, Quick Dash, Burrow Strike, Tail Flick
Animals.description: A colorful land crab found in Central American tropical forests. Halloween Crabs are mostly terrestrial, feeding on detritus, fruits, and plant matter, using their strong claws for defense and digging burrows for shelter.

Animals.name: Honeycomb Grouper
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Crush Grip, Bubble Blast
Animals.description: A small to medium-sized reef-dwelling fish found in tropical Indo-Pacific oceans. Honeycomb Groupers are ambush predators, feeding on smaller fish and crustaceans, using their camouflage and bursts of speed to strike prey.

Animals.name: Albemarle Lava Lizard
Animals.moves: Tail Whip, Sand Dash, Bite, Sun Bask, Quick Scratch, Camouflage
Animals.description: Small, agile reptiles native to the Galápagos Islands. They thrive on volcanic rocks, where they bask in the sun and feed on insects. Known for quick bursts of speed and territorial displays, Lava Lizards are resilient survivors of harsh volcanic landscapes.

Animals.name: Spectacled Salamander
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Sticky Tongue, Shadow Step, Water Glide, Quick Retreat, Camouflage
Animals.description: A small, secretive amphibian native to southern Italy. Named for the pale markings around its eyes that resemble spectacles, it is mostly active at night and in humid forests. Despite its fragile appearance, the salamander is a skilled survivor, relying on stealth and camouflage.

Animals.name: Amazonian Giant Centipede
Animals.moves: Venom Bite, Segment Slam, Quick Scuttle, Burrow Ambush, Grasping Legs, Toxic Fang
Animals.description: Among the largest centipedes in the world, reaching up to 30 cm, this predator feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and even small mammals. With lightning speed and powerful venom, it ambushes prey in the dense jungles of South America.

Animals.name: European Green Crab
Animals.moves: Claw Pinch, Shell Guard, Side Scuttle, Bubble Spray, Tide Ambush, Sand Burrow
Animals.description: A small but aggressive shore crab native to European coasts, now notorious as an invasive species worldwide. With a strong grip and high adaptability, it thrives in many environments and often outcompetes native crabs for food and habitat.

Animals.name: Masked Booby
Animals.moves: Beak Jab, Wing Buffet, Aerial Dive, Ocean Glide, Fish Snatch, Soaring Strike
Animals.description: The largest booby species, recognized by its dark facial mask and strong build. Found across tropical oceans, the Masked Booby hunts fish and squid by soaring over the waves and diving with precision.

Animals.name: Red-footed Booby
Animals.moves: Beak Jab, Wing Buffet, Aerial Dive, Ocean Glide, Fish Snatch, Soaring Strike
Animals.description: The smallest and most agile of the boobies, the Red-footed Booby is easily recognized by its bright red feet and slender frame. It excels at long-distance ocean foraging, often traveling hundreds of kilometers from its nesting grounds to hunt fish and squid.

Animals.name: Audubon’s Shearwater
Animals.moves: Beak Peck, Ocean Glide, Soaring Sweep, Fish Snatch, Feather Dodge, Diving Strike
Animals.description: A small seabird of tropical and subtropical waters, Audubon’s Shearwater is a master glider that uses air currents over the waves to travel vast distances. It dives for fish and squid, often hunting in flocks far from shore.

Animals.name: Wandering Albatross
Animals.moves: Beak Jab, Wing Buffet, Ocean Soar, Gust Sweep, Fish Snatch, Aerial Endurance
Animals.description: Famous for having the largest wingspan of any living bird, the Wandering Albatross can glide for hours without flapping. It roams the Southern Ocean, covering thousands of kilometers in search of squid and fish. Revered as a symbol of freedom, it is also threatened by longline fishing and plastic pollution.

Animals.name: Herring Gull
Animals.moves: Beak Peck, Wing Buffet, Fish Snatch, Trash Raid, Aerial Sweep, Loud Call
Animals.description: A large, adaptable gull found across Europe, Asia, and North America. Known for its intelligence and boldness, the Herring Gull feeds on fish, invertebrates, carrion, and even human refuse. It thrives in both wild coastal habitats and heavily urbanized environments.

Animals.name: Emperor Penguin
Animals.moves: Beak Peck, Belly Slide, Flipper Slap, Ice Swim, Huddle Guard, Deep Dive
Animals.description: The tallest and heaviest penguin species, Emperor Penguins are remarkable for their survival in Antarctica’s extreme cold. They dive deep to hunt fish, squid, and krill, and are famous for their cooperative huddling behavior to endure freezing blizzards.

Animals.name: King Penguin
Animals.moves: Beak Peck, Belly Slide, Flipper Slap, Ice Swim, Huddle Guard, Deep Dive
Animals.description: Native to sub-Antarctic islands, King Penguins are slightly smaller than Emperors but still formidable swimmers and divers. They feed primarily on fish and squid, and form large breeding colonies on beaches and rocky shores.

Animals.name: Galapagos Penguin
Animals.moves: Beak Peck, Belly Slide, Flipper Slap, Ice Swim, Huddle Guard, Deep Dive
Animals.description: The only penguin species that lives north of the equator, found on the Galápagos Islands. These small penguins have adapted to warm tropical waters, feeding on small fish and evading predators both in water and on rocky shores.

Animals.name: Surinam Toad
Animals.moves: Sticky Tongue, Mud Slam, Water Glide, Tail Flick, Quick Snap, Defensive Curl
Animals.description: A flat, fully aquatic frog native to the rivers and wetlands of northern South America. Known for its unique reproductive strategy—females carry eggs embedded in their back—this toad ambushes insects and small fish while remaining hidden in muddy waters.

Animals.name: Spix's Macaw
Animals.moves: Wing Slash, Quick Dive, Aerial Dash, Feather Flick, Tail Strike, Gust Blast
Animals.description: A critically endangered parrot native to Brazil’s dry forests. Known for its vibrant blue plumage, Spix’s Macaw uses agility and intelligence to forage for seeds, fruits, and nuts, often navigating dense vegetation with precision.

Animals.name: Polar Bear
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Bite, Powerful Charge, Ice Stomp, Aqua Roar, Defensive Stance
Animals.description: The largest terrestrial carnivore, Polar Bears are apex predators of the Arctic. They hunt seals on sea ice, are excellent swimmers, and have adapted to extreme cold with thick fur and fat layers.

Animals.name: Walrus
Animals.moves: Tusk Strike, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Belly Slide, Horn Guard, Ice Push
Animals.description: A large marine mammal of the Arctic, walruses are known for their long tusks, thick blubber, and social behavior. They feed primarily on benthic invertebrates, and their size and strength make them formidable both in water and on ice.

Animals.name: Southern Elephant Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Tuskless Charge, Aqua Roar, Belly Slide, Defensive Guard
Animals.description: The largest seal species, found in sub-Antarctic and Antarctic coastal regions. Males are huge and dominate breeding beaches, while both sexes are excellent divers, hunting squid and fish in cold ocean waters.

Animals.name: Leopard Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Ice Ambush
Animals.description: A top predator of Antarctic waters, the Leopard Seal preys on penguins, fish, and smaller seals. Known for its powerful jaws and agility in water, it is both feared and respected in its icy habitat.

Animals.name: Bearded Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Ice Ambush
Animals.description: A medium-sized Arctic seal with prominent whiskers, Bearded Seals inhabit shallow coastal waters and rely on benthic invertebrates for food. They are strong swimmers and use their flippers and teeth to forage and defend against predators.

Animals.name: Harbor Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Ice Ambush
Animals.description: A widespread pinniped found along temperate and Arctic coastlines. Harbor Seals feed on fish, squid, and crustaceans, using stealth and agility in water to evade predators like orcas and sharks.

Animals.name: Ringed Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Ice Ambush
Animals.description: A small Arctic seal that lives among sea ice. Ringed Seals feed mainly on fish and crustaceans, and their ability to create breathing holes in ice helps them evade predators and survive harsh polar conditions.

Animals.name: Harp Seal
Animals.moves: Bite, Flipper Slam, Aqua Roar, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Ice Ambush
Animals.description: A medium-sized Arctic seal found on pack ice in the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. Harp Seals feed primarily on fish and crustaceans, and are well adapted to icy environments, using their flippers and agility to navigate ice floes and avoid predators.

Animals.name: Abyssal Grenadier
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Quick Dash, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Depth Strike
Animals.description: A deep-sea fish found at extreme depths in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Abyssal Grenadiers feed on small invertebrates and carrion, surviving in near-total darkness and under immense pressure.

Animals.name: American Sand Lance
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Quick Dash, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Depth Strike
Animals.description: Small, slender fish found along sandy coastal areas of temperate and tropical oceans. Sand Lances feed on plankton and small invertebrates, often forming dense schools to avoid predators.

Animals.name: Antarctic Krill
Animals.moves: Swarm Rush, Tiny Pinch, Plankton Feed, Quick Flick, Evasive Swim, Group Formation
Animals.description: A small but vital crustacean of the Southern Ocean, krill form enormous swarms that sustain penguins, seals, whales, and many fish. Despite their size, their ecological role is massive, making them the cornerstone of Antarctic food webs.

Animals.name: Baltic Isopod
Animals.moves: Pinch, Burrow, Scuttle, Carapace Guard, Sand Cover, Scavenge
Animals.description: A large cold-water isopod found in the Baltic Sea and other northern waters, Saduria entomon lives on the seabed where it scavenges for dead animals and organic matter. Though not flashy, it plays a key role in recycling nutrients within its ecosystem.

Animals.name: African Tiger Fish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Bite, Agile Swim, Tackle
Animals.description: A fierce freshwater predator found in rivers and lakes across central and southern Africa. Known for its razor-sharp teeth and aggressive hunting, the African Tiger Fish preys on smaller fish and occasionally attacks birds or mammals near the water’s edge.

Animals.name: Goliath Tiger Fish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Bite, Agile Swim, Tackle
Animals.description: The largest and most formidable freshwater predator of Africa, the Goliath Tiger Fish inhabits the Congo River basin. With enormous teeth and immense strength, it preys on large fish and occasionally small mammals near the water.

Animals.name: Mekong Giant Barb
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Water Push, Defensive Guard
Animals.description: The largest freshwater fish in Southeast Asia, the Mekong Giant Barb inhabits the Mekong River. A peaceful herbivore, it feeds on plants and small invertebrates, but its massive size makes it a formidable presence and difficult prey for predators.

Animals.name: Mekong Giant Catfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Water Push, Defensive Guard
Animals.description: One of the largest freshwater fish in the world, the Mekong Giant Catfish inhabits the Mekong River in Southeast Asia. A peaceful filter-feeder, it primarily consumes plankton and plant matter, but its enormous size makes it nearly invulnerable to most natural predators.

Animals.name: Goonch Catfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Roar, Tackle, Water Push, Defensive Guard
Animals.description: A massive predatory catfish native to rivers of South and Southeast Asia. The Goonch Catfish feeds on fish, mammals, and other riverine animals, using stealth and immense strength to overpower prey.

Animals.name: Wallago Catfish
Animals.moves: Whisker Whip, Bite, Tail Slap, Mud Stir, Quick Swim, Splash Charge
Animals.description: A large freshwater catfish found in South and Southeast Asian rivers. Wallago Catfish are aggressive predators, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals, using speed and stealth to ambush prey.

Animals.name: Channel Catfish
Animals.moves: Whisker Whip, Bite, Tail Slap, Mud Stir, Quick Swim, Splash Charge
Animals.description: A medium-sized freshwater catfish native to North America. Highly adaptable, it thrives in rivers and lakes, feeding on fish, insects, and small crustaceans. Channel Catfish are known for their sharp spines and excellent sense of smell.

Animals.name: Flathead Catfish
Animals.moves: Heavy Bite, Tail Slam, Mud Camouflage, Lunge, Body Press, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A large North American catfish that prefers to lurk near the riverbed. Flathead Catfish are solitary predators, ambushing prey such as fish and crayfish. Their broad, flat heads give them a powerful bite and excellent camouflage.

Animals.name: Golden Mahseer
Animals.moves: Scale Bash, Bite, Current Charge, Fin Strike, Jump Slam, Swift Swim
Animals.description: A legendary freshwater fish of South and Southeast Asian rivers, prized for its golden scales and immense strength. Known as the “tiger of the river,” the Golden Mahseer is both a fierce predator and a symbol of power in its ecosystem.

Animals.name: Vundu Catfish
Animals.moves: Powerful Bite, Tail Smash, Mud Cloud, Lunge, Bottom Roll, Rest
Animals.description: A massive African catfish found in rivers and lakes across sub-Saharan Africa. Vundu are opportunistic feeders, consuming fish, crustaceans, and even carrion. They are among the largest freshwater fish in Africa, known for their endurance and adaptability.

Animals.name: Amazon Redtail Catfish
Animals.moves: Crushing Bite, Tail Slam, Body Charge, River Rush, Mud Surge, Fin Smash
Animals.description: A striking South American giant, the Amazon Redtail Catfish is easily recognized by its bright red tail and massive size. Found in rivers, lakes, and flooded forests of the Amazon Basin, it is an aggressive bottom-dweller that preys on fish, crustaceans, and anything it can swallow whole.

Animals.name: Blue Catfish
Animals.moves: Crushing Bite, Tail Slam, Body Charge, River Rush, Mud Surge, Fin Smash
Animals.description: The largest catfish native to North America, Blue Catfish thrive in rivers and reservoirs. Known for their endurance and strength, they are powerful swimmers that feed on fish, mussels, and invertebrates. Their adaptability has made them an invasive species in some regions.

Animals.name: Wels Catfish
Animals.moves: Devour Bite, Tail Smash, Ambush Lunge, Mud Cloud, Body Slam, Deep Roar
Animals.description: One of the largest freshwater fish in Europe, the Wels Catfish can grow to enormous sizes and dominate its ecosystem. Opportunistic and sometimes aggressive, it feeds on fish, waterfowl, and even small mammals. Its sheer bulk and power make it a true river monster.

Animals.name: Atlantic Stingray
Animals.moves: Tail Whip, Sting Strike, Sand Cloud, Quick Glide, Fin Slap, Dash
Animals.description: A medium-sized stingray found in coastal waters, estuaries, and occasionally rivers along the western Atlantic. Recognizable by its diamond-shaped body and venomous tail spine, the Atlantic Stingray feeds on small invertebrates buried in the sand.

Animals.name: Black Diamond Stingray
Animals.moves: Venom Tail, Sand Burst, Aqua Glide, Fin Slam, Bottom Roll, Rapid Dash
Animals.description: A striking freshwater stingray native to the Xingu River in Brazil, the Black Diamond Stingray is prized for its black body covered in brilliant white spots. It feeds on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish, using stealth and sudden strikes to capture prey.

Animals.name: Giant Whiptail Stingray
Animals.moves: Crushing Fin, Tail Lash, Mud Surge, Bottom Sweep, Aqua Push, Venom Strike
Animals.description: The largest freshwater stingray in the world, the Giant Whiptail Stingray can grow over 5 meters across and weigh several hundred kilograms. Found in Southeast Asian rivers, it is a bottom-dweller that feeds on fish, crustaceans, and mollusks, using its immense size and whip-like tail for defense.

Animals.name: Pearl River Stingray
Animals.moves: Tail Lash, Fin Slam, Mud Cloud, Quick Glide, Bottom Sweep, Aqua Strike
Animals.description: A freshwater stingray found in the Pearl River system of China. This medium-sized stingray prefers sandy or muddy bottoms and feeds on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish. Its patterned body allows it to blend into the riverbed for ambush hunting.

Animals.name: Black Piranha
Animals.moves: Razor Bite, Fin Slash, Aqua Dash, Jaw Clamp, Blood Frenzy, Tail Flick
Animals.description: A predatory freshwater fish of South America’s rivers, especially the Amazon Basin. Known for its razor-sharp teeth and ferocious feeding behavior, the Black Piranha preys on fish, insects, and small vertebrates, often striking in coordinated attacks.

Animals.name: Red-bellied Piranha
Animals.moves: Razor Bite, Fin Slash, Aqua Dash, Jaw Clamp, Blood Frenzy, Tail Flick
Animals.description: One of the most famous Amazonian predators, the Red-bellied Piranha is notorious for its sharp teeth and feeding frenzies. It hunts in schools, feeding on fish, insects, and occasionally small mammals or birds.

Animals.name: Grass Carp
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to East Asia. Grass Carp are primarily herbivorous, feeding on aquatic plants, and play an important role in controlling vegetation in rivers and lakes. Despite their peaceful diet, they can grow very large and have strong swimming ability.

Animals.name: Mirror Carp
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A domesticated variant of common carp, Mirror Carp are found in rivers, lakes, and ponds worldwide. They are known for their large, reflective scales and calm, bottom-feeding behavior. While not aggressive predators, their size and endurance make them tough opponents in territorial disputes.

Animals.name: Bighead Carp
Animals.moves: Head Slam, Water Swipe, Tail Flick, Aqua Glide, Mouth Scoop, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to East Asia, the Bighead Carp primarily feeds on plankton. Known for its enormous head and fast growth, it is often introduced to control algae in lakes and rivers. While peaceful, its size and schooling behavior make it a dominant presence in freshwater habitats.

Animals.name: Common Carp
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: One of the most widespread freshwater fish in the world, Common Carp are native to Europe and Asia but have been introduced globally. They are omnivorous bottom feeders, eating plants, insects, and detritus, and are known for their resilience and adaptability.

Animals.name: Asian Stinging Catfish
Animals.moves: Spine Jab, Bite, Mud Dart, Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Aqua Slash
Animals.description: A small but venomous freshwater catfish found across South and Southeast Asia. Known for its sharp dorsal spines that deliver venom, it feeds on insects, small fish, and detritus, using agility and venomous strikes to defend itself.

Animals.name: Nile Tilapia
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A widely distributed freshwater fish native to Africa but introduced worldwide. Tilapia are omnivorous and highly adaptable, feeding on plants, insects, and small invertebrates. Their hardiness and schooling behavior make them resilient in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs.

Animals.name: Swamp Barb
Animals.moves: Quick Bite, Fin Flick, Tail Slam, Aqua Dash, Water Jab, Mud Stir
Animals.description: A small freshwater fish native to South and Southeast Asia, often found in rivers, swamps, and flooded fields. Swamp Barbs are fast, schooling fish that feed on insects, small crustaceans, and plant matter.

Animals.name: Catla
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A large freshwater carp native to rivers and lakes of South Asia. Catla are primarily surface feeders, consuming plankton and small fish. They are fast-growing and form an important part of riverine and aquaculture ecosystems.

Animals.name: Rohu
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A major freshwater carp of South Asia, Rohu is an important species for rivers, lakes, and aquaculture. It feeds on plankton and plant matter, growing large and forming dense schools that provide both food and ecological balance.

Animals.name: Australian Longfin Eel
Animals.moves: Coil Strike, Bite, Aqua Glide, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Mud Surge
Animals.description: A large freshwater eel native to rivers, lakes, and estuaries of eastern Australia. Longfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and invertebrates. They are renowned for their endurance, ability to migrate long distances, and slippery, agile movements.

Animals.name: Australian Shortfin Eel
Animals.moves: Coil Strike, Bite, Aqua Glide, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Mud Surge
Animals.description: A medium-sized freshwater eel found in rivers, lakes, and estuaries across Australia and New Zealand. Shortfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are known for their quick movements and ability to navigate complex aquatic environments.

Animals.name: African Pike
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Aqua Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes across Africa. African Pike are solitary hunters, feeding on smaller fish and invertebrates. They rely on stealth and sudden bursts of speed to ambush prey, making them agile and formidable hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Northern Pike
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Aqua Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.

Animals.name: Walleye
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Aqua Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes of North America. Walleye are known for their excellent vision in low light and feed on smaller fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are agile hunters, often striking under the cover of darkness.

Animals.name: Pikehandle Barracuda
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Body Charge, Quick Strike
Animals.description: A predatory fish of coastal and estuarine waters in the western Atlantic and Caribbean. Pikehandle Barracudas are fast, aggressive hunters, feeding on smaller fish with sudden bursts of speed. They are agile and rely on ambush tactics to capture prey.

Animals.name: Great Barracuda
Animals.moves: Razor Bite, Aqua Dash, Tail Slash, Body Slam, Fin Strike, Frenzy Charge
Animals.description: A powerful predator of tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide, the Great Barracuda is known for its torpedo-like body and fearsome jaws. With lightning-fast strikes and sharp teeth, it preys on fish, squid, and occasionally smaller marine animals. Its intimidating presence has earned it a reputation as one of the ocean’s most aggressive hunters.

Animals.name: Beluga Sturgeon
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Fin Slash, Aqua Dash, Body Slam, Quick Strike
Animals.description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.

Animals.name: White Sturgeon
Animals.moves: Body Slam, Tail Sweep, Jaw Crush, Aqua Push, Heavy Charge, Fin Guard
Animals.description: The largest freshwater fish in North America, the White Sturgeon can live for over a century and reach massive sizes. Dwelling in deep rivers and estuaries, it feeds on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Its slow but deliberate movements are backed by tremendous strength, making it a dominant presence in its habitat.

Animals.name: Butterfly Peacock Bass
Animals.moves: Bite, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Aqua Strike, Body Slam, Tail Whip
Animals.description: A colorful predatory cichlid native to South America, especially the Amazon Basin. The Butterfly Peacock Bass is admired for its bright patterns and aggressive hunting style. It feeds on fish and crustaceans, striking with speed and precision. Popular among anglers, it’s both a beautiful and formidable freshwater predator.

Animals.name: Chinese Seerfish
Animals.moves: Razor Bite, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Quick Strike, Body Slam, Frenzy Rush
Animals.description: A fast, predatory mackerel found in the coastal and estuarine waters of the South China Sea and surrounding regions. Known for its streamlined body and sharp teeth, the Chinese Seerfish preys on small fish and squid, relying on bursts of speed to ambush and chase down its meals. It is a prized fish for both commercial fishing and sport.

Animals.name: Chinook Salmon
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Aqua Dash, Tail Strike, Body Slam, Leap Charge, Bite
Animals.description: The largest of the Pacific salmon, Chinook are powerful swimmers known for their epic migrations from the ocean into freshwater rivers to spawn. They are opportunistic predators, feeding on smaller fish, squid, and crustaceans in the ocean before expending their strength in upriver journeys. Highly valued for both their ecological role and as a prized catch.

Animals.name: Coho Salmon
Animals.moves: Fin Slash, Aqua Dash, Tail Strike, Body Slam, Leap Charge, Bite
Animals.description: Also called the Silver Salmon, the Coho is a smaller but agile member of the Pacific salmon family. Known for its silvery body and powerful jumps, it thrives in both marine and freshwater environments. Coho feed on fish and invertebrates in the ocean before migrating upriver to spawn, where they display bright red coloration.

Animals.name: Largemouth Bass
Animals.moves: Bite, Tail Whip, Quick Dash, Aqua Strike, Fin Slam, Body Slam
Animals.description: A highly adaptable freshwater predator native to North America, Largemouth Bass are one of the most popular sport fish worldwide. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and swamps, using stealth and sudden bursts of speed to prey on fish, frogs, insects, and even small birds. Their aggressive feeding behavior makes them formidable hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Orinoco Peacock Bass
Animals.moves: Bite, Aqua Strike, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Crush, Body Slam
Animals.description: A striking and aggressive predatory fish from the Orinoco River Basin, the Orinoco Peacock Bass is renowned for its vivid coloration and fierce hunting style. It preys primarily on smaller fish, using ambush tactics and explosive bursts of speed. Highly prized by anglers, it is one of the most iconic freshwater game fish of South America.

Animals.name: Giant Trevally
Animals.moves: Power Slam, Razor Bite, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Body Charge, Frenzy Rush
Animals.description: A powerful predatory jack of the Indo-Pacific, the Giant Trevally dominates coral reefs, coastal zones, and open waters. It hunts both alone and in groups, preying on fish, squid, and even birds, known for its explosive bursts of speed and raw power. Revered as a trophy fish, it is considered one of the toughest fighters in the ocean.

Animals.name: Ruby Snapper
Animals.moves: Bite, Tail Slam, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Heavy Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: A deepwater predator found across the Indo-Pacific, the Ruby Snapper is known for its striking reddish coloration and adaptability to depths over 100 meters. Feeding on fish, squid, and crustaceans, it is both a skilled hunter and a valuable commercial fish. Its endurance and strength make it a respected inhabitant of reef slopes and offshore waters.

Animals.name: Silver Carp
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Bite, Water Swipe, Aqua Glide, Plant Crunch, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A fast-growing freshwater carp native to East Asia. Silver Carp feed primarily on plankton and detritus, forming dense schools that can impact river ecosystems. Though peaceful, their size and numbers make them ecologically dominant in many rivers and lakes.

Animals.name: Danube Salmon
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Body Slam, River Roar
Animals.description: Also called Huchen, the Danube Salmon is a large, predatory salmonid native to the Danube and other European rivers. It feeds on fish, insects, and small amphibians, using stealth and bursts of speed to ambush prey. Considered a trophy fish, it is one of Europe’s most iconic freshwater predators.

Animals.name: Siberian Taimen
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Aqua Dash, Fin Slash, Body Slam, River Roar
Animals.description: The largest salmonid in the world, the Siberian Taimen inhabits rivers across Siberia and Mongolia. A solitary apex predator, it feeds on fish, small mammals, and birds, striking with immense power and speed. Its size, strength, and endurance make it a dominant force in cold freshwater ecosystems.

Animals.name: Florida Gar
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Body Slam, Water Snap
Animals.description: A medium-sized gar native to freshwater rivers, lakes, and swamps of Florida. Florida Gars are ambush predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and insects. Their elongated body and armored scales make them resilient hunters in shallow waters.

Animals.name: Longnose Gar
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Body Slam, Water Snap
Animals.description: A large North American gar, the Longnose Gar inhabits rivers, lakes, and bayous. Known for its elongated snout filled with sharp teeth, it is an ambush predator feeding on fish, crustaceans, and occasionally small amphibians. Its armored scales provide strong protection against attacks.

Animals.name: Spotted Gar
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Quick Dash, Fin Slash, Body Slam, Water Snap
Animals.description: A medium-sized North American gar found in rivers, lakes, and swamps. Spotted Gars are ambush predators feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. Their distinctive spots help them blend into murky waters, making them effective stealth hunters.

Animals.name: Green Sawfish
Animals.moves: Rostrum Slash, Tail Whip, Aqua Charge, Body Slam, Bottom Sweep, Quick Glide
Animals.description: A large, critically endangered sawfish found in coastal and riverine waters of the Indo-Pacific. It uses its long, toothed snout to detect and incapacitate prey such as fish and crustaceans. Despite its slow swimming speed, its strength and specialized rostrum make it a formidable predator.

Animals.name: Largetooth Sawfish
Animals.moves: Rostrum Slash, Tail Whip, Aqua Charge, Body Slam, Bottom Sweep, Quick Glide
Animals.description: One of the largest and most powerful sawfish species, the Largetooth Sawfish inhabits rivers, estuaries, and coastal waters worldwide. It uses its long, toothed snout to stun and incapacitate fish and crustaceans. Despite being slow-moving, its immense strength and armored body make it a top predator in its habitats.

Animals.name: American Gizzard Shad
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Fin Swipe, Aqua Glide, Body Slam, Splash
Animals.description: A common freshwater fish of North America, found in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs. Gizzard Shad feed on plankton and detritus, forming large schools that help protect them from predators. Though small, they are ecologically important as a primary food source for larger fish and birds.

Animals.name: Bigmouth Buffalo
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Fin Swipe, Aqua Glide, Body Slam, Splash
Animals.description: A large freshwater fish native to North American rivers and lakes. Bigmouth Buffalo are primarily filter feeders, consuming plankton and detritus. They can grow very large and are long-lived, making them an important species in freshwater ecosystems.

Animals.name: Sterlet
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Fin Swipe, Aqua Glide, Body Slam, Splash
Animals.description: A small sturgeon native to rivers of Eastern Europe and Western Asia. Sterlets feed on small fish, invertebrates, and detritus. Though much smaller than other sturgeons, they are valued for their caviar and play a role in maintaining river ecosystem balance.

Animals.name: Black Drum
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Fin Swipe, Aqua Glide, Body Slam, Splash
Animals.description: A large coastal and estuarine fish found along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts of North America. Black Drum feed on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish, using their strong jaws to crush prey. They are slow-moving but resilient, making them a notable predator in their habitats.

Animals.name: Lake Sturgeon
Animals.moves: Heavy Slam, Tail Sweep, Jaw Crush, Body Block, Aqua Surge, River Charge
Animals.description: A large freshwater sturgeon native to North American lakes and rivers. Lake Sturgeon are slow but powerful, feeding on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Known for their longevity and size, they are important apex fish in their habitats.

Animals.name: Smooth-head Blobfish
Animals.moves: Body Slam, Aqua Push, Fin Flick, Tail Slam, Quick Glide, Splash
Animals.description: A gelatinous deep-sea fish found off the coasts of Australia and Tasmania. Smooth-head Blobfish are adapted to high-pressure environments and feed on small invertebrates. Their soft body makes them highly resilient to crushing pressure but slow-moving.

Animals.name: Bluegill
Animals.moves: Quick Dash, Tail Flick, Fin Swipe, Aqua Glide, Splash, Bite
Animals.description: A small freshwater sunfish native to North America. Bluegill are schooling fish feeding on insects, small crustaceans, and plankton. They are agile and form the base of many freshwater food chains.

Animals.name: Bowfin
Animals.moves: Lunge Bite, Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Quick Dash, Body Slam, Aqua Strike
Animals.description: A primitive freshwater predator native to North American rivers, lakes, and swamps. Bowfins feed on fish, amphibians, and crustaceans. They are ambush predators with strong, elongated bodies and sharp teeth, making them effective hunters in their habitats.

Animals.name: Brown Bullhead Catfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Bite, Aqua Dash, Body Slam, Mud Sweep
Animals.description: A small to medium-sized freshwater catfish native to North America. Brown Bullheads are bottom feeders, eating insects, small fish, and detritus. They are hardy and adapt well to various freshwater environments, including rivers, lakes, and swamps.

Animals.name: Piraiba
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Jaw Crush, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Body Slam, Fin Crush
Animals.description: One of the largest catfish in the Amazon, the Piraiba inhabits rivers and lakes across South America. A powerful predator, it feeds on fish and small aquatic animals, using its immense size and strength to dominate its environment.

Animals.name: Walking Catfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Bite, Quick Dash, Body Slam, Aqua Glide
Animals.description: A small to medium freshwater catfish native to Southeast Asia. Walking Catfish are known for their ability to traverse land in search of water. They feed on fish, insects, and detritus, making them versatile predators in their habitats.

Animals.name: African Cheetah
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Bite, Pounce, Sprint Dash, Quick Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: The fastest land animal on Earth, native to African savannahs and grasslands. Cheetahs rely on explosive speed and agility to hunt antelope and other small to medium prey. Despite their incredible speed, they have moderate stamina and low defense.

Animals.name: Aardwolf
Animals.moves: Bite, Claw Swipe, Quick Dash, Pounce, Body Slam, Scratch
Animals.description: A small African mammal related to hyenas, feeding primarily on termites and insects. Aardwolves are nocturnal and rely on stealth to forage.

Animals.name: African Golden Cat
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Bite, Pounce, Quick Dash, Sprint Attack, Body Slam
Animals.description: A medium-sized wild cat native to West and Central African forests. African Golden Cats are elusive and skilled hunters, feeding on birds, small mammals, and reptiles.

Animals.name: African Lion
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Bite, Pounce, Roar, Charge, Body Slam
Animals.description: A large apex predator native to African savannahs. Lions hunt cooperatively in prides, feeding on herbivores like zebras and antelopes. Known for strength, teamwork, and dominance in their ecosystem.

Animals.name: American Bison
Animals.moves: Headbutt, Charge, Body Slam, Hoof Stomp, Horn Strike, Tail Whip
Animals.description: A massive herbivore native to North American plains. Bison are social animals that graze on grasses and can defend themselves with strength and horns.

Animals.name: American Black Bear
Animals.moves: Claw Swipe, Bite, Body Slam, Maul, Charge, Roar
Animals.description: A medium to large North American bear found in forests and river valleys. Omnivorous and versatile, black bears feed on plants, insects, fish, and mammals.

Animals.name: Longnose Velvet Dogfish
Animals.moves: Jaw Crush, Tail Slam, Fin Flick, Body Slam, Aqua Strike, Quick Glide
Animals.description: A small deep-sea shark found in North Atlantic waters. Longnose Velvet Dogfish feed on fish and cephalopods, adapted to deep, dark environments with slow swimming and ambush tactics.

Animals.name: Silver Chimaera
Animals.moves: Jaw Crush, Tail Slam, Fin Flick, Aqua Strike, Body Slam, Quick Glide
Animals.description: A deep-sea cartilaginous fish found in the North Pacific. Silver Chimaeras feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using stealth and slow ambush attacks in deep waters.

Animals.name: Tropical Sawshark
Animals.moves: Rostrum Slash, Tail Slam, Body Slam, Aqua Strike, Fin Crush, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A small tropical sawshark native to coastal waters and reefs. It uses its toothed snout to detect and slash fish and crustaceans.

Animals.name: Whalesucker
Animals.moves: Tail Flick, Body Slam, Fin Swipe, Quick Dash, Aqua Glide, Bite
Animals.description: A small fish that attaches to larger marine animals like whales and sharks. Whalesuckers feed on parasites and scraps, gaining mobility and protection from their hosts.

Animals.name: Reef Manta Ray
Animals.moves: Fin Crush, Tail Slam, Aqua Strike, Body Slam, Quick Dash, Glide Strike
Animals.description: A large ray inhabiting coral reefs and coastal waters of the Indo-Pacific. Reef Manta Rays feed on plankton and small fish while gliding gracefully, using size to deter predators.

Animals.name: Giant Oceanic Manta Ray
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Body Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Glide Strike
Animals.description: The largest species of manta ray, found in open oceans worldwide. Feeds on plankton and small fish, using massive size to dominate its territory.

Animals.name: Duckbill Eagle Ray
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Aqua Strike, Fin Crush, Body Slam, Quick Dash, Glide Strike
Animals.description: A ray species inhabiting coral reefs and coastal areas of the Indo-Pacific. Feeds on crustaceans and small fish, using gliding movements to ambush prey.

Animals.name: White-spotted Eagle Ray
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Fin Crush, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Body Slam, Glide Strike
Animals.description: A large ray found in tropical and subtropical reefs. White-spotted Eagle Rays feed on mollusks and crustaceans, using powerful tail strikes and gliding to hunt.

Animals.name: Ocean Sunfish
Animals.moves: Body Slam, Tail Slam, Aqua Push, Fin Crush, Aqua Strike, Glide Strike
Animals.description: One of the largest bony fish, Ocean Sunfish inhabit open oceans worldwide. They feed on jellyfish and plankton and rely on size and thick skin for protection.

Animals.name: Brachymystax lenok
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Jaw Crush, Fin Crush, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Body Slam
Animals.description: A freshwater salmonid native to Siberian and East Asian rivers. Lenok feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using speed and ambush tactics in cold waters.

Animals.name: Crocodile Catfish
Animals.moves: Tail Slam, Jaw Crush, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Body Slam, Fin Crush
Animals.description: A large freshwater catfish resembling a small crocodile. Crocodile Catfish are apex predators, feeding on fish, amphibians, and small mammals in rivers and lakes.

Animals.name: Highland Copperhead
Animals.moves: Bite, Coil Strike, Quick Dash, Venom Strike, Tail Slam, Constrict
Animals.description: A venomous snake native to the highlands of southeastern Australia. Highland Copperheads hunt small mammals, birds, and amphibians, using stealth and venom to immobilize prey.

Animals.name: Togian Babirusa
Animals.moves: Tusk Strike, Bite, Charge, Body Slam, Hoof Stomp, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A wild pig native to the Togian Islands of Indonesia. Known for its distinctive tusks and strong body, it feeds on roots, fruits, and small animals in forests and swamps.

Animals.name: African Wild Dog
Animals.moves: Bite, Claw Swipe, Pounce, Sprint Dash, Quick Strike, Body Slam
Animals.description: An African carnivore known for cooperative hunting in packs. African Wild Dogs hunt antelopes and other medium-sized prey, relying on stamina, teamwork, and strategy.

Animals.name: Dingo
Animals.moves: Bite, Claw Swipe, Pounce, Quick Dash, Sprint Attack, Body Slam
Animals.description: A wild dog native to Australia, dingoes are adaptable hunters feeding on mammals, birds, and reptiles. They are fast, intelligent, and opportunistic predators.

Animals.name: Tasmanian Devil
Animals.moves: Bite, Claw Swipe, Body Slam, Maul, Charge, Quick Dash
Animals.description: A carnivorous marsupial native to Tasmania. Tasmanian Devils feed on carrion and small animals, known for powerful jaws, aggressive behavior, and loud screeches.

Animals.name: Brandts Cormorant
Animals.moves: Beak Strike, Wing Slash, Dive Attack, Quick Dash, Peck, Body Slam
Animals.description: A large seabird found along the Pacific Coast of North America. Brandts Cormorants are skilled divers, feeding on fish and invertebrates under the sea.

Animals.name: Double-crested Cormorant
Animals.moves: Beak Strike, Dive Attack, Peck, Wing Slash, Quick Dash, Body Slam
Animals.description: A widespread North American waterbird that dives underwater to catch fish. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and coasts.

Animals.name: Sea Otter
Animals.abilities: Kelp Forager  Gains defense and regeneration bonus when in kelp forests.
Animals.moves: Bite, Claw Swipe, Body Slam, Roll, Quick Dash, Tail Slam
Animals.description: A marine mammal native to the North Pacific, sea otters are known for tool use and feeding on shellfish while floating in kelp forests.

Animals.name: Leather Star
Animals.abilities: Regenerator  Recovers health when in tidepools.
Animals.moves: Suction Grip, Star Slam, Body Slam, Crawl, Slow Crush, Hold
Animals.description: A starfish species of the North Pacific. It feeds on sponges and other invertebrates and is recognizable by its leathery texture.

Animals.name: Ochre Sea Star
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Titan  Gains defense when holding ground in rocky shores.
Animals.moves: Suction Grip, Star Slam, Body Slam, Slow Crush, Crawl, Hold
Animals.description: A keystone predator in intertidal ecosystems, feeding on mussels and barnacles. Found on rocky Pacific shores.

Animals.name: Purple Sea Urchin
Animals.abilities: Spiny Defense  Gains high defense when stationary.
Animals.moves: Spine Jab, Roll, Crawl, Hold, Spiny Slam, Slow Crush
Animals.description: A spiny echinoderm inhabiting tidepools and kelp forests. Purple Sea Urchins feed on algae and can drastically shape ecosystems.

Animals.name: Red Sea Urchin
Animals.abilities: Armor Spines  Boosts defense when under attack.
Animals.moves: Spine Jab, Roll, Hold, Crawl, Spiny Slam, Slow Crush
Animals.description: One of the largest sea urchins, found in the Pacific. Red Sea Urchins feed on kelp and are important in marine ecosystems.

Animals.name: Sunflower Star
Animals.abilities: Multi-limbed Hunter  Gains attack bonus when swarming prey with many arms.
Animals.moves: Star Slam, Suction Grip, Body Slam, Crawl, Crush, Hold
Animals.description: A massive starfish with up to 24 arms, found in the North Pacific. It preys on sea urchins, clams, and other invertebrates.

Animals.name: Bat Star
Animals.abilities: Filter Forager  Gains health recovery when scavenging detritus.
Animals.moves: Suction Grip, Body Slam, Crawl, Hold, Star Slam, Slow Crush
Animals.description: A small, brightly colored sea star native to the Pacific coast. Bat Stars feed on detritus and algae.

Animals.name: Blood Star
Animals.abilities: Tidepool Forager  Gains minor regeneration in shallow waters.
Animals.moves: Suction Grip, Body Slam, Crawl, Hold, Star Slam, Slow Crush
Animals.description: A small red starfish found along the Pacific coast. Blood Stars primarily feed on sponges and microorganisms.

Animals.name: Cushion Star
Animals.abilities: Cushion Defense  Inflates to deter predators, gaining defense.
Animals.moves: Star Slam, Suction Grip, Body Slam, Crawl, Hold, Inflate
Animals.description: A thick-bodied starfish found in the Pacific. Its puffed-up appearance provides protection from predators.

Animals.name: Six-rayed Starfish
Animals.abilities: Six-limbed Grasp  Gains better hold on prey with six arms.
Animals.moves: Suction Grip, Body Slam, Crawl, Hold, Star Slam, Slow Crush
Animals.description: A small starfish of the Pacific Northwest intertidal zone. Known for its six arms and predation on mussels and barnacles.

Animals.name: Brown Smoothhound Shark
Animals.abilities: Swift Hunter  Gains speed and attack when chasing schooling fish.
Animals.moves: Bite, Tail Slam, Body Slam, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Fin Crush
Animals.description: A small houndshark of the Eastern Pacific, feeding on fish and invertebrates.

Animals.name: California Yellowtail
Animals.abilities: Schooling Predator  Gains attack bonus when hunting in groups.
Animals.moves: Bite, Fin Slash, Quick Dash, Aqua Strike, Body Slam, Tail Slam
Animals.description: A large schooling fish found in the Eastern Pacific. Known for speed and strength, often targeted by fishers.

Animals.name: Leopard Shark
Animals.abilities: Striped Stalker  Gains stealth and attack in shallow waters.
Animals.moves: Bite, Tail Slam, Body Slam, Aqua Strike, Quick Dash, Fin Crush
Animals.description: A small shark species with spotted patterns, found along the Pacific Coast of North America.

Animals.name: Great White Shark
